comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: I found out that the abbrevation A.S.P.C. stood for Air Service Production Center (for the US Military in WW1). A.S.P.C. No.2 was based at Romorantin Aerodrome (France) and was the receiving point for all Liberty DH-4 planes shipped from the United States as well as a salvage area for wrecked airplanes. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Air_Service_American_Expedi...
